channel.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
channel.description: ok here is my next question my mothers grate uncle is a computer wiz kid...well wiz old guy he had the first pc ever made (not mening the first pc... the first type) and he has loved them and spent 90% of his time on it (hence the mile thick glasses lol..) and he told me you could format a exturnal hard drive then do somthing to it and then it would act as your main (:C) drive hence you will have a new comp bacicaly and then all you have to do is change an option some were and you get your internal haddrive back as your (main) one... so dose eny one no how to do this or have a site that explains how?

item.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

yeh but if you are using windows xp you need to have the windows xp files instald to the exturnal HD then in your bios change it i wonder if it would work now all i need is the program windows xp home or pro

Read full topic

item.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

So in theory you could duel boot an iMac for OSX and XP with Terminal? Hmm… I have to try all this out with the extra space I got on my iPod

item.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

in bios you can change your boot configurations, select the usb device and install an OS

item.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

But would it work for a windows base PC? I want to transfer my Movies and etc to my Laptop but will the extra disk be plug-in-and-play? At least it’s that way for me with iMac’s ^.^

Read full topic
item.source: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?

item.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

using an external hard drive would be horribly slow for the useage require as a ‘main’ drive

item.title: Exturnal hard drive runing your pc?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

What he’s saying… is if you can use a external HD to run your comp… I have an external because I ran out of space on my iMac… It runs quiet nicely… But certainly wouldn’t be my main HD… This is a project I might try on my shitty IBM I got laying around somewhere…
